com.cmt3319.game
Class GamePlayScreen

java.lang.Object
  com.cmt3319.interfaces.Screen
      com.cmt3319.game.GamePlayScreen

public class GamePlayScreen
extends com.cmt3319.interfaces.Screen

Runs and updates game play screen. Includes drawing and updating Map, drawing and updating Player, drawing and updating Score, running CloudManager, accepting user input i.e. jump and stop running, and handling pausing and quiting of game using a game state manager. Extends Screen. The game state manager has ready, running, paused and gameover states. In the running state the game is being played and the map and player input accepted and updated. The ready state waits for the user to tap on the screen once and then it transistions to the running state. The paused state occurs when the user taps on the pause image whilst in the running state. This provides resume and quit options. Resume goes back to running and quit loads MainMenuScreen.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Robert Wells

Method Detail

update

public void update(float deltaTime)
Calls other methods depending on the game state: 
 if(state = ready)
        invoke updateReady(List);
 else if(state = running)
        invoke updateRunning(List, float);
 else if(state = paused)
        invoke updatePause(List);
 else
        invoke updateGameOver(List);
The methods are passed a list of touchevents.

Specified by:
update in class com.cmt3319.interfaces.Screen

private void updateReady(java.util.List<com.cmt3319.interfaces.Input.TouchEvent> touchEvents)

private void gameOver()

CheckOutOfBounds

private java.lang.Boolean CheckOutOfBounds()
Checks if player is on screen. Used by updateRunning(List, float).

Returns:
returns true if player is not on screen.

updateRunning

private void updateRunning(java.util.List<com.cmt3319.interfaces.Input.TouchEvent> touchEvents,
                           float deltaTime)
The main update method for game play: 
 
 if(CheckOutOfBounds())
        set player alive = false;
        set game state = Game Over;
        return;
 
 if(MovingObject.isMoving()()
        update world location (Map.updateWorldLocation(float, Score))
        update cloud manager (CloudManager.update(float))
 
 update player (Player.update(float))
 
 if(player collides with hazard Map.checkPlayerCollisionWithHazard(MovingObject))
        set state to game over;
        return;
 
 Check player collision with reverse gravity; (Map.checkPlayerCollisionWithReverseGravity(MovingObject))
 
 Check player collision with floor/wall; (Map.checkObjectCollisionWithFloor(MovingObject))
 
 Check player collision with collectibles; (Map.checkCollectibleCollision(Score, MovingObject))
 
 for(each enemy in Map.getEnemies()) {
        update enemy; (MovingObject.update(float)
        check collision with floor; 
        if(enemy collides with player(Map.checkCollisionBetweenObjects(MovingObject, MovingObject)) {
                set state to game over;
                return;
        }
 }
 
 Check for input by calling updateRunningInput(List);

updateRunningInput

private void updateRunningInput(java.util.List<com.cmt3319.interfaces.Input.TouchEvent> touchEvents)
Handles input when game is running in this order: 
 for each event:
        if(event = touch down) {
                if(paused image has been pressed) {
                        Set game state to paused;
                        return;
                }
 
                if(right side of screen pressed) {
                        make player jump; (MovingObject.setJumping(Boolean))
                }
 
                if(left side of screen pressed) {
                        set player moving to false; (MovingObject.setMoving(Boolean))
                }
 
        }
 
        if(event = touch up) {
                if(right side of screen had touch removed) {
                        stop player jumping;
                }
 
                if(left side of screen had touch removed) {
                        set player moving to true;
                }
        }

updatePause

private void updatePause(java.util.List<com.cmt3319.interfaces.Input.TouchEvent> touchEvents)
Checks if resume or quit images are pressed. Resume sets game state to running, and quit sets MainMenuScreen as current screen.

Parameters:
touchEvents - passed from update(float)

updateGameOver

private void updateGameOver(java.util.List<com.cmt3319.interfaces.Input.TouchEvent> touchEvents)
Checks if restart or quit images are pressed. Restart loads a new GamePlayScreen and sets gravity to normal, and quit sets MainMenuScreen as current screen.

Parameters:
touchEvents - passed from update(float)

present

public void present(float deltaTime)
Invokes CloudManager.draw(Graphics), Map.drawWorld(Graphics), Player.draw(Graphics), and Score#draw(Graphics) regardless of game state. Draws "taptostart" image if game state equals ready, draws pause menu if game state equals running, draws resume and quit images if game state equals paused, and draws restart and quit images if state equals game over.

Specified by:
present in class com.cmt3319.interfaces.Screen
